ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 13, 2024
STEPHANIE A DETTLOFF
CHILD & FAMILY SERVICES - NORTHEAST MICHIGAN
1044 US HIGHWAY 23 N,
ALPENA, MI, 49707-1250
RE: License#: CB040201041
Dear STEPHANIE A DETTLOFF:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 12/12/2024. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The agency Interim inspection was completed on 2/15/24 and the CAP was
approved on 6/17/24. The agency was cited for 4 violations, 1 of which was a
repeat violation. None of these areas were identified in noncompliance as a part
of this renewal evaluation.
SIR #2023C000705SI was completed and required a CAP that was approved
12/07/2023. The noncompliance was with Rule R 400.12607. The agency did not
have documentation to substantiate the agency provided a copy of an adoption
evaluation to an applicant who was denied approval as determined by the
evaluation. The corrective action was that the agency revised the spreadsheet that
is utilized to track this information to include this documentation requirement. A
copy of the revised spreadsheet establishing compliance was received 12/12/2024
as a part of this renewal evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment included a review of the agency's progress in
implementing corrective actions to establish compliance with the areas identified in
noncompliance for the interim evaluation completed 2/15/2024. More consistent
use of the available tools indicated progress in establishing and maintaining
compliance.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
Staff Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Individual staff
interviews did not identify any areas of concern.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and adoption services. All files were stored
securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert #1: One home was in need of a smoke detector.

Resolution: The smoke detector was provided and installed with picture
confirmation provided for compliance. The alert was approved by DCWL 9/26/2024.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
12/13/2024
